qas.question: When was the Cork South Link dual carriageway built?
What was the purpose of the dual carriageway?

answers.text: to link the Kinsale Road roundabout with the city centre

qas.question: What was the purpose of the Kinsale Road flyover?

answers.text: remove a bottleneck for traffic heading to Cork Airport or Killarney

qas.question: What was a beneficial improvement made to Patrick Street?
What was linked to The Kinsale Road roundabout in the 1990's?
What tunnel passes over the Lee River?
What Links Patrick Street with Dublin?
In what year was the Kinsale Road roundabout built?
Why did the N25 South Ring Road open in 2006?

plausible_answers.text: for traffic heading to Cork Airport or Killarney

qas.question: From who would the N25 South Ring Road help remove the bottleneck?
What does the Jack Lynch Tunnel link Mallow with?
What improvement was made to N20 Blackpool bypass to make it safer?

context: The Cork area has seen improvements in road infrastructure in recent years. For example, the Cork South Link dual carriageway was built in <b8_0>the early <a0_0><b4_0>1980s<b8_0/><a0_0/>,<b4_0/> <a1_0>to link the Kinsale Road roundabout with the <b5_0>city centre<b5_0/><a1_0/>. Shortly afterwards, the first sections of the South Ring dual carriageway were opened. Work continued through the 1990s on extending the N25 South Ring Road, with the opening of the <b6_0>Jack Lynch Tunnel<b6_0/> under the River Lee being a significant addition. The Kinsale Road flyover opened in August 2006 <b9_0>to <a2_0>remove a bottleneck<b9_0/> <b10_0>for traffic heading to Cork Airport or Killarney<b10_0/><a2_0/>. Other projects completed at this time include the N20 Blackpool bypass and the N20 Cork to Mallow road projects. The N22 Ballincollig dual carriageway bypass, which links to the Western end of the Cork Southern Ring road was opened in September 2004. City Centre road improvements include the Patrick Street project - which reconstructed the street with a <a3_0><b12_0>pedestrian focus<b12_0/><a3_0/>. The <b7_0>M8 motorway<b7_0/> links Cork with <b11_0>Dublin<b11_0/>.
